question.text:
Following is the list of STDs. Select the diseases which are not completely curable.
A. Genital warts
B. Genital herpes
C Syphilis
D Hepatitis-B
E Trichomoniasis
Choose the correct answer from the

solution.text:
The correct answer is option (2) -B and D only because except for hepatitis -B, genital herpes and HIV infections, other sexually transmitted diseases are completely curable, if detected early and treated properly.
- Genital warts, syphilis and trichomoniasis are completely curable STDs upon proper detection and treatment.
- Option (1) is incorrect as it includes genital warts
- Option (3) is incorrect as it includes genital warts and syphilis.
- Option (4) is incorrect as it includes trichomoniasis.
Genital warts, genital herpes and hepatitis -B are viral STDs, syphilis is a bacterial and trichomoniasis is a protozoan STD.
